qas.question: Who was elected Vice President of the United States in 1864?
Which Confederate state's representation was readmitted to Congress first?
On which date were Tennessee's elected representatives restored to their offices in Washington D.C.?
Their ratification of which Amendment spared Tennessee a military governor during Reconstruction?
In which year did Andrew Johnson become President?

context: In 1864, <a0_0>Andrew Johnson<a0_0/> (a War Democrat from Tennessee) was elected Vice President under Abraham Lincoln. He became President after Lincoln's assassination in <a4_0>1865<a4_0/>. Under Johnson's lenient re-admission policy, <a1_0>Tennessee<a1_0/> was the first of the seceding states to have its elected members readmitted to the U.S. Congress, on <a2_0>July 24, 1866<a2_0/>. Because Tennessee had ratified the <a3_0>Fourteenth<a3_0/> Amendment, it was the only one of the formerly secessionist states that did not have a military governor during the Reconstruction period.
